sect2.title: Installation of Virtuoso
sect2.para: Install virtuoso by running the following commands:
Virtuoso does not come with a callable test suite. An intensive check routine is part of the build process.

sect2.title: Command Explanations
sect2.para: --without-internal-zlib: This option is set to use the installed zlib and not the bundled one.
--program-transform-name: Both Virtuoso and unixODBC install a program named isql. Use this option to rename virtuosos program to isql-v
--disable-all-vads: This option disables the building of all the VAD packages (tutorials, demos, etc.).
--disable-static: This option disables the building of static libraries. However, the main virtuoso library, libvirtuoso-t, is still built as a static library.
--enable-python: Add this option if Python is installed. It enables the use of Python by Virtuoso.
--with-port: Add this if you want the virtuoso server to listen on another port than 1111.

note.para: If Virtuoso is only to be used for KDE, there is no need to start the Virtuoso server at boot time.

sect3.title: Boot Script
sect3.para: If you want the Virtuoso server to start automatically when the system is booted, install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/virtuoso init script included in the package.

sect3.title: User accounts
sect3.para: When the server is started using the start script, there is a web interface to Virtuoso at . Several links are pointing to the OpenLink site, but the Conductor at . This is a full featured configuration site for Virtuoso. Login as dba with the predefined password dba.

warning.title: Change password
warning.para: Remember to immediatly change the password of user dba as well as of all other predefined users. Click on [System Admin] and than on [User Accounts].
